alert.note: Alert for Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 2:48PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Ulster and northern Dutchess Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 248 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Katrine, or near Saugerties, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingston, Saugerties, Rhinebeck, Pleasant Valley, Pine Plains, Red Hook, Lake Katrine, Stanfordville, Staatsburg, Saugerties South, Port Ewen, Bethel, Veteran, Milan, Tivoli, Salt Point, Norrie Heights, Kerleys Corners, Katsbaan and Sweet Meadows. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 19 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess
